member.name: IFullScreenVideoEx.CountModes

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The CountModes method retrieves the number of display modes that the Full Screen Renderer supports.

member.param: Pointer to the returned mode count.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IFullScreenVideoEx.GetAcceleratorTable

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetAcceleratorTable method retrieves the accelerator table currently being used to translate keyboard messages. The Full Screen Renderer filter does not support this method.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives a window handle. The window receives translated messages.
Pointer to a variable that receives a handle to the accelerator table.

member.name: IFullScreenVideoEx.GetCaption

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetCaption method retrieves the caption associated with the full-screen window.

member.param: Pointer to a BSTR that receives the caption.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IFullScreenVideoEx.GetClipFactor

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The GetClipFactor method retrieves the clip factor, which determines how much of the video the Full Screen Renderer is allowed to clip. For example, if the clip factor is 25, the Full Screen Renderer can clip up to 25% of the video.

member.param: Pointer to a variable the receives the clip factor.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IFullScreenVideoEx.GetCurrentMode

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetCurrentMode method retrieves the current display mode.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the index of the current video mode. Pass this index to the method to obtain information about this mode, including the width, height, and bit depth.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: The filter did not load DirectDraw.

member.name: IFullScreenVideoEx.GetMessageDrain

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetMessageDrain method retrieves the window that receives mouse and keyboard messages, if any.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the handle of the window. If no window has been designated to receive messages, this parameter receives the value NULL.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IFullScreenVideoEx.GetModeInfo

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetModeInfo method retrieves information about a specified display mode supported by the Full Screen Renderer filter.

member.param: Index of the display mode.
Pointer to a variable that receives the width of the display mode, in pixels.
Pointer to a variable that receives the height of the display mode, in pixels.
Pointer to a variable that receives the bit depth of the display mode.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: The specified display mode is not available and is disabled.

member.name: IFullScreenVideoEx.GetMonitor

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetMonitor method queries which monitor the Full Screen Renderer is using. The Full Screen Renderer only supports the primary monitor, so the returned value is always zero.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the index of the monitor.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The HideOnDeactivate method . Depending on the setting, the full-screen video window is either minimized or hidden. If it is minimized, it appears as an icon in the task bar; otherwise, it does not.

param.name: Hide
param.para: Value that specifies the behavior when the application is deactivated. Set to OATRUE to hide the icon; set to OAFALSE to display the icon.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The IsHideOnDeactivate method indicates the behavior when the user switches to another application. Depending on the setting, the full-screen video window is either minimized or hidden. If it is minimized, it appears as an icon in the task bar; otherwise, it does not.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IsKeepPixelAspectRatio method queries whether the pixel aspect ratio is maintained. The Full Screen Renderer filter does not support this method; it always maintains the pixel aspect ratio.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the value OATRUE or OAFALSE.

The IsModeAvailable method queries whether a specified display mode is available.

member.name: IFullScreenVideoEx.KeepPixelAspectRatio

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The KeepPixelAspectRatio method specifies whether to maintain the pixel aspect ratio. The Full Screen Renderer filter does not support this method; it always maintains the pixel aspect ratio.

member.param: Specifies whether to maintain the aspect ratio. The value must be OATRUE or OAFALSE.

Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetAcceleratorTable method specifies an accelerator table that will be used to translate keyboard messages. The Full Screen Renderer filter does not support this method.

Handle to the accelerator table.

MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetCaption method sets the caption associated with the full-screen window.

member.param: String containing the caption.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IFullScreenVideoEx.SetClipFactor

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetClipFactor method specifies the clip factor, which determines how much of the video the Full Screen Renderer is allowed to clip.

For example, suppose the display mode is 320 x 200 and the video is 352 x 288 pixels. Assuming the decoder cannot shrink the video, the display will clip about 25 percent of the image. The clip factor specifies the upper range that is permitted. The default value is 25%.

member.param: Specifies the maximum allowable amount of the image to clip. The value is expressed as a percentage from 0 to 100.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetDefault method saves the current settings.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetEnabled method enables or disables a specified display mode.

member.param: Index of the display mode to enable or disable.

param.name: bEnabled
param.para: Specifies one of the following Boolean values:

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetMessageDrain method specifies a window to receive mouse and keyboard messages from the video window.

member.param: Specifies a handle to the message-drain window.

member.name: IFullScreenVideoEx.SetMonitor

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetMonitor method specifies which monitor to use. The Full Screen Renderer only supports the primary monitor, however, so this method is not useful in the current implementation.

member.param: Specifies the index of the monitor to use. Must be zero in the current implementation.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The IFullScreenVideoEx interface is implemented on the Full Screen Renderer filter, which provides full-screen video rendering on older hardware. Newer video cards can stretch the video efficiently enough that the Full Screen Renderer is not required. Therefore, both the filter and this interface are now deprecated.
